He's leaving tomorrow morning, then going to Ghana, Burkina Faso and South Africa to push for the AU leaders to respect the AU position( that Gbagbo must step down) . Salim Lone , who earlier said Raila Odinga believed he was making progress, did not give a reason for the curtailed visit, the latest in a series of failed efforts to force Gbagbo out.

Micah Zenko , a political scientist at the Council on Foreign Relations, extensively researched U.S. planning for a military strike on Khurmal in 2002 and detailed it in his book Between Threats and War. He said in an interview that he was unaware that Rumsfeld had advocated bombing the place while Colin Powell was at the U.N.
